comm: over the wicekt, good length on the stumps to begin with, Burns tucks one in front of square
bit of inswing this time, 79mph, Finch prods it watchfully towards midwicket
again the ball dips back at Finch, who's walking across his stumps, Willey appeals for lbw as the ball skips away fine to the boundary
on the pads, the ball shaping and this time Finch just gets a tickle of bat on it to pick up four to long leg
Willey shifts his line across to middle and off, there's an appeal for lbw, maybe some bat involved but the ball loops short of slip
a much better lbw shout, Willey straightening the ball on leg stump... but Dharmasena decides it was missing leg
starts on a decent line outside off, Burns watches it through to the keeper
touch short, tapped in front of square and they take the single, Finch slipped over, preventing a second
back of a length outside off, 89mph and blocked with a straight bat
in the channel, Finch dabs it softly towards backward point
sharp from Wood, 92mph and the ball goes thudding into Finch's knee roll, Wood exercises his lungs but umpire Gough gives a shake of the head - probably going down leg, a touch high too
pitched up on the stump, Finch plays a regal-looking on drive but sends it straight to mid-on
length ball, shaping back in, Burns defends watchfully
another appeal, Burns beaten past the inside edge, 82mph and rapped on the thigh pad in front of middle and off... Too high
on the stumps, slightly back of a length, flicked off the thigh pad behind square

short and slightly wide and there's room for Finch to crush the ball through the covers, looks like four all the way until James Taylor whirs into the picture and dives to scoop it back with an inch to spare

angled across, Burns prods at it... and plays on to his stumps! An unconvincing stay from Burns, didn't really get a feel for ball on bat and this time a fraction of inward movement results in a drag-on. The ball was not quite there to cut, no real conviction in the shot
short over off stump and Smith taps to the leg side
shortish, on the stumps and tucked through backward square for a single
full and straight, pinged back smoothly along the ground, Moeen makes a diving stop to his left at mid-on
back of a length, 90mph and worked away through square leg
full and straight and punched back to mid-on
goes wide and spears the ball in on the stumps, jabbed towards square leg
back of a length on off stump, 87mph and Finch rocks back to pull one down to fine leg
Willey floats the ball up towards Finch's toes, he punches to mid-on, who's set back and there's room for a quick single
length delivery, angled across the right-hander from over the wicket, no stroke
touch shorter and on leg stump, 78mph, tucked away through backward square
pushed across, fullish and tempting the drive, Finch narrows his eyes and watches it through
full on the pads, Finch flicks at it and the ball rolls away behind square
nice shape on this, gentle pace swinging back in at Smith, who's more than comfortable with the ball on his pads and glances another single through backward square
fullish outside off, Smith comes forward and shows it a straight bat
length outside off, squares Smith up a touch and a thick edge flies wide of slip down to third man
89mph darting in on off stump, Wood appeals as the ball rattles the front pad... but only after it had clipped the inside edge
dabbed into the leg side and they take on Rashid's arm - a direct hit would have been interesting but I think Finch had rumbled through okay
pitched up outside off and driven to mid-off
length ball outside off, 90mph, Smith waves his wand and manages a thick inside edge through backward square
slides down the leg side
lovely line from Willey, enticing Smith into an expansive drive and he plays around it on the up

pinned in front, Smith falling over his feet - gone! A corking delivery, right up in the blockhole and Smith failed to get bat on it this time as he swung across the line, hit on the back foot plumb in front of middle and off, the ball curving back beautifully... Thinks about a review but instead decides to take his medicine and head for the dressing room
pushed across, this one goes on with the arm and whooshes past the outside edge. Lovely bowling
off-stump line, this time Bailey covers it and defends
slanted towards the slips on a length, hits the seam and straightens a tough but wide enough for Bailey to leave

oh dear, what's Bailey done... he plants his front foot and raises his bat out of the way, hit bang on the knee roll. Dharmasena takes a few moments to mull it over before shaking his head. Probably didn't come back enough and England elect not to review, knowing it needed to be red-red-red to overturn the decision
pitched up in the channel and Finch tries to boom it down the ground, carves out a slice of fresh air!
length ball around off stump, this time Finch defends
fuller, Finch gets forward and checks a drive into the off side
beauty from Wood, 91mph on a full length and it jags away past the outside edge as Finch feels for it
robust response, the ball seaming back in, stands up tall and crunches a drive through the covers, no one is catching that
slightly back of a length outside off, lets this one zip through
another full in-ducker from Willey, nearly skewers Bailey in the manner of Smith, just manages to get his bat down in time and squeeze it behind square
pushed across outside off, Finch lets it go

goes on with the arm, Finch feels for it and nicks off! Willey fell over in his follow through and had to appeal from the floor - but it's Australia who looking unsteady on their feet, three down for spit. Willey has been mixing up inswingers with bother-balls in the channel, Finch wasn't quite sure what was coming and just got a thin snick through to Bairstow
slighty full outside off, Maxwell comes forward and lets it go
tight to off stump, holding its line, again left alone
brilliant stop in the covers! Full delivery and Maxwell leathered a drive that was grabbed on the bounce by a leaping Taylor
fired in towards the stumps, Maxwell prods at it and gets an inside edge through the leg side
length ball, left alone outside off
good length, shaping away as Bailey again leaves with a flourish
comes across and steers one through backward point... and Wood has overstepped

full and straight and swung back down the ground, Maxwell was aiming for cow corner, it came off the bat sticker but still had enough on it to beat mid-off and run to the boundary - only the third of the innings so far
shuffles across and pokes a length ball towards cover
pitched up, Maxwell drives and edges to second slip where it's dropped by the diving Jason Roy! He got down to it well enough but the ball clunked off his wrists to earth. Oh dear
length ball angled across outside off, pushed towards point
pitched up and Maxwell isn't going to sit and fret about being dropped, he reaches for a drive, in the air but square of cover and it runs away to the fence
another full delivery and another driven four! Lights, camera, action for the Big Show, this was an even better shot, lacing the ball along the ground through the covers
tighter line, Maxwell works it off his hips to midwicket for one
length ball on off stump, tapped into the covers
goes round the wicket, full length outside off, Bailey this time gets his drive through and, despite a valiant dive from Taylor on the boundary, picks up four
pitched up full outside off and Maxwell creams another boundary through the covers. Can change a game quickly, this fellow
shortish, moves outside off and blocks into the covers
good length in the channel, one Yorkshire player to another, left alone
ooh, that's a jaffa from Plunkett, scissoring past the outside edge on off stump
back of a length, opens the face and steers one off the outside edge to third man
angled in towards the stumps, Bailey works the ball to leg and takes another single
pitched up in the channel, Bailey drives off the front foot through the covers
full, slower delivery, deceives Maxwell as he pushes forward, Bairstow can't gather it cleanly either
full length, Maxwell advances and cracks a drive out towards deep extra cover
comes forward and blocks into the off side
pitched up, Bailey bunts it back down the pitch and Stokes catches it one-handed on the bounce, then gestures to throw at the stumps... Bailey cracks into a grin, though perhaps not wilfully
tight line, good length, defended coming forwards - decent start from Stokes
back of a length and speared through gully, not much to this but placement between two fielders
lovely stuff from Maxwell, too full and straight and it's sent with withering force back past the stumps at the other end for four
good response from Plunkett, gets this to nibble away from slightly back of a length, past Maxwell's bat
slightly leg side, flicks the pad and dribbles to Bairstow's left
oof, he's hit on the groin and grimaces, understandably, the ball came back at him sharply
on the stumps, dabbed into the leg side Maxwell charges through for one despite the fielder closing in
full length in the channel, punched through the covers
pitched up outside off, Bailey plays this with an open face and gets it square in front of deep extra cover for a couple
low full toss from Stokes, 87mph but he can only toe-end it along the carpet to mid-off
goes a little wider, rising through off a length as Bailey thrust out his front leg and shoulders arms
done him, good length outside off, Bailey nearly hangs himself out to dry but fails to get a touch on it
fullish and a touch wide, steered through the covers on the front foot
back of a length and pushed into the covers
teasing line from Plunkett, gets the ball to straighten off the pitch and beat Bailey's waft

nip-backer this time, Bailey is trapped on the crease... Not given but England decide to use their review. Think this is a bit of a gamble, Bailey was struck on the knee roll, so height probably an issue and it looked to be heading towards leg stump, too. Yep, Joel Wilson confirms via Hawk-Eye that it was heading over the top of leg, so Bailey endures
short and wide and crashed in front of deep extra cover by way of punishment, meaty cut from from Bailey for his second boundary
on the stumps, stays back and pushes one in front of square
imperious from Maxwell! Not much footwork, just waits for an overpitched delivery on off and belts it back fine of mid-off. Woof
starts with an offspinner on the stumps, just a loosener and Bailey tucks to leg
tossed up out of the back of the hand this time, Bailey punches one through the covers
floated up on the stumps, Maxwell can't get it away
flatter, goes back on middle and leg and pulls through midwicket into the deep
lovely stuff from Rashid, gives it some air and then rips the ball past the outside edge and into the keeper's gloves as Bailey presses forward
tossed up even slower, worked down the ground to long-on
short-length slower ball, down the leg side
pitched up around off stump, tapped back towards the bowler
on the stumps, closes the face and tucks a single past midwicket

short ball, slapped in the air towards fine leg... "Catch!" yells Stokes but Rashid misjudges it and Maxwell is dropped again! It was a tough-ish chance, diving forwards, but like Roy he got there only to fluff the chance, barely got fingertips on it
and Bailey does the salt-rubbing, smashing a full delivery past cover on the drive
good length, gets forward and dabs a single square on the off side
rolls his fingers over the ball, outside off stump, Maxwell waits and chops one to third man
looped outside off, Bailey delicately guides the ball off an open bat face past short third man for three
flighted on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
length ball, spinning from middle to off, Maxwell plays a cross-batted shot but can't get it away
pitched up, Maxwell is forward to drive, Rashid dives to his left to collect
gives it some air outside off, punched through the covers for a couple
full toss, on the stumps and swept through square leg for a couple more
on the stumps and worked away through midwicket
pitched up outside off and Maxwell swings vengefully through the line, gets one through the covers - 100 up for Australia, this is looking like a decent recovery, with the sun now out
pitched up and defended coming forwards
in the channel, Bailey gets into line and taps towards cover
possibly another cutter from Stokes, pushed back towards the bowler
beaten again, there's still a little juice for the seamers, a length ball zipping through to Bairstow
tossed up and mistimed back towards Rashid
flighted outside off, Maxwell steps out and punches a single down the ground
driven in the air but through the bowler's hands! Tough one for Rashid, as Bailey advanced and thumped it back over his head, long-on prevents it going for four
on the stumps and spinning away past off as Bailey leaves
tossed up and pushed back to the bowler
pushed through outside off stump, steered off the back foot straight to short third man
short and swatted in front of deep midwicket for four! Powerful pull stroke from Maxwell, the ball flying away as he rattled his wrists through the shot
pitched up outside off this time and steered in front of point for one more
bouncer from Stokes, nearly gets Bailey into a tangle, he tries to pull but is beaten for pace
slower ball, Bailey adjusts and taps back to the bowler
excellent fielding from Roy at slip, Bailey edging the ball but playing with soft hands, looked to be bouncing wide until it was grabbed one-handed to prevent a run
bit of width and this is plated late, out of the middle and in front of third man, who can't prevent four
tossed up and flicked to midwicket, who underarms at the stumps - and hits - but Bailey was in his ground and momentarily thinking about a single
full toss from Rashid and Maxwell gets out his ice cream scoop, helps himself over deep midwicket - that's gone miles back, and it brings up his fifty in appropriately bruising style
drags this one down and Maxwell has to fetch it from outside off... but still it flies for six! Just manages to get it over the rope at wide long-on
goes inside out this time, slicing four out towards deep extra cover - three boundaries in a row, no sympathy shown for his Yorkshire team-mate
pushed through flat and Maxwell settles for a punch to long-off
comes forward and taps the ball back to the bowler
tossed up outside off and Maxwell cracks a reverse sweep through point for four from Moeen's first ball. Welcome, sir
comes forward and can't get this one away
tossed up, Maxwell waits for it and nurdles one around the corner to backward square leg
floated up outside off, Bailey is down early and paddles a couple fine on the leg side
full length, Bailey attempts the reverse-sweep himself but fails to connect
comes forward and then blocks back to the bowler with bat next to pad
low full toss from Rashid and Maxwell just clears midwicket off the toe of the bat, into a gap and it bounces to the rope
pushed through wide of the stumps, Maxwell drags it down to long-off
tossed up, skips forward and pushes one more down the ground
flat outside off, Maxwell sits back and swipes a single through point
gives it some air, defended on the front foot
again Bailey comes forward on off stump, doesn't get to the pitch and pads it into the covers
tossed up, clipped back down the track coming fowards
slower from Moeen, around off stump, Maxwell drives and gets an inside egde through midwicket
skips out and flicks to leg, it's in the air for a while but bounces in front of Rashid at square leg
angled in, Maxwell walks out and whips one more through mid-on
Bailey goes down early to paddle and Bairstow attempts to cut it off, it would have been a brilliant piece of work but the ball is flicked at the last minute past his chin for a couple
flighted outside off and this time Bailey gets the reverse-sweep away, cracks it to the fence
tossed up outside off, tapped into the covers
well bowled, gives it a rip and spins the legbreak past the bat, Bairstow then whips off the bails in one smooth motion but Maxwell hadn't gone anywhere
on the stumps, just a tickle of inside edge and it runs fine towards the boundary, won't quite go all the way
pushed through on leg stump and Bailey drops his bat on it late
spinning away outside off, swatted through cover point for one more
tossed up, Bailey comes down the pitch and punches a single to long-off
floated up on the stumps and worked through the legs ide
flatter trajectory outside off, Maxwell reverses the hands and gets some glove on it past the keeper
on the stumps, turned through midwicket
tossed up, Maxwell clips another single through square leg
pushed through outside off, Bailey reverses the hands but this time fails to connect
quicker ball from Moeen, a leading edge pops into the off side and runs through mid-off to take Bailey to 49 and keep him on strike
slightly short outside off and chopped through the covers - there's Bailey's fifty, Australia looking in much better shape than an hour ago
back of a length, worked to the leg side but not past short midwicket
shortish, bit of width and Maxwell throws the hands, slices one down to third man
back of a length and defended around off stump
pitched up, shuffles forward and drills the ball to mid-off

full on the stumps, this time Bailey on drives, but again the ball zips across the pitch to the fielder and prevents a single being taken - decent return from Plunkett but England need a few more tight overs
drops a little short, pulled through backward square leg with the turn

tossed up outside off, Bailey tries to reverse-sweep again, misses and Bairstow grabs the ball by his knees... Michael Gough shakes his head, looks like it hit the upper arm and then rebounded off his helmet
on the stumps and nurdled through the leg side

speared in and leg stump is pegged back, Maxwell bowled trying to reverse-sweep! The onslaught is over, a reversey Percy too many, though it's a surprise that Maxwell got it wrong rather than Bailey... The ball was straight and skipped under the bat as Maxwell aimed another swingeing swat through point
on the stumps and tapped through square leg to get going
flat on the stumps, Bailey comes forward and plays across the line, deflects off his pad to a gap at midwicket
tossed up and bunted back to the bowler, into the ground first but the crowd didn't realise that
tossed up outside off, spinning away and Bailey leaves it
flighted on the stumps, comes forward and pushes one back past the bowler to long-on
flighted, outside off stump, Marsh comes forward and then taps gently through the covers
dragged down a touch as Bailey advances, transfers the weight back and cuts through cover point
tossed up outside off, sits back and swats one more out towards deep extra cover
pushed through on the stumps and punched down the ground
worked through the leg side
on the stumps, takes another single through midwicket
pushed through outside off, deflected towards short third man
tossed up on the stumps, Bailey dances and flicks to leg, can't beat short midwicket
pushed through quite quick outside off, attempts a late cut but again it's cut off on the edge of the ring - good over from Moeen
tossed up nice and slow, pushed back to the bowler
advances to a full ball and clips one down the ground
flighted, legbreak outside off, Bailey tries to hoick it to leg but is hit in the midriff
tossed up outside off, gets forward to drive but finds extra cover
low full toss from Rashid, comes out and taken down the ground for one to long-on
gives it some air, dipping and straightening on the stumps, worked to leg but can't find a gap
flighted, Bailey gets out and pushes back to the bowler
pushed through outside off, Bailey tires to reverse-sweep once more, there's a big appeal from Bairstow... Think the noise was bat hitting ground
on the stumps, shuffles out and pushes a single to long-on
angled in with the arm, Marsh taps defensively to the leg side
tossed up on the stumps, comes forward, can't get it away
length ball, Marsh looks a little uncertain and can only work it back to the bowler
very full from Rashid, drifting towards leg stump, gets forward and clips through midwicket
tossed up on the stumps and nurdled through the leg side
full and flighted, driven hard but straight back to the bowler
slow and loopy outside off, it's the googly and the ball comes back in to cramp Bailey's cut
that's how you deal with the cute stuff, dances out to the pitch and clubs the ball beyond the ropes straight back down the ground - first boundary in almost ten overs
drags this down a little quicket, pushed back down the track
tossed up and Marsh has a big swing to leg, skips away off the inside edge
length ball spinning in, worked across the line and it rolls of the pad
Moeen spots Bailey moving around in his crease and fires the ball in on his leg stump, scores a hit on the pads
tossed up and pushed through mid-on coming forwards
drifting to the leg side, Marsh closes the face and clips one through backward square
length delivery, turned to short backward square, straight to the fielder and there's no run
on the back foot, punched up to long-on, just the single
twiddled onto the toes, helped out to deep midwicket. Another one to the total.
a googly, slightly back of a length and easily sighted, pushed down to long-on again
tossed up wider, slammed into the covers where Taylor plugs the gap with a sharp dive and a wring of the fingers
worked into the leg-side again
tidy over, completed with a sixth single out of six, into the leg side. Ten overs for 63 is his day's work
tucked into the leg-side, another single
twirled onto a good length, worked up to long-on
another exchange of singles. They all count.
defended into the covers
two steps down the track and chipped into the leg-side
down the track but thwarted in his intentions. Tidy work from the spin twins.
works the gap, Australia dealing in singles for the moment
blocked down the track
on the pads, whisked away firmly through midwicket for a welcome boundary. That was sweetly timed off the toes
short and pulled, but not timed as the sweeper tidies up
defended into the covers
squared up a touch on off stump. Good lifting delivery, fenced out to point
good late adjustment from Ali, who saw his man coming and speared it down the leg-side, looking for the stumping. Bailey got enough pad on it though
chipped up towards mid-on, in the air for a while
on a good length again, defended from the crease
wider outside off stump, met with a fat front pad with bat tucked behind it, and in fact it's called as a dead ball for no stroke offered. A moot point.
defended again
good delivery to finish, attacking the pads and no way to capitalise for the batsman
full, straight, chipped high and hard but only as far as David Willey at long-off who took a well-judged catch in the deep. Instant strike for England and that target of 300 takes a touch of a dent
Bailey, the anchorman, defends down the track

gosh, now that changes things! Bailey was early onto the drive, the ball stopped in the pitch, popped up off the bat sticker, and straight back into the bowler's grateful mitts! England, it is fair to say, are bossing this Powerplay.
a full face of the bat to launch his ODI career
pushed onto the back foot, but more reassuring bat on ball for the new boy
straighter onto the pads, turned round the corner for a single. Lovely over for England's ambitions. Two wickets and one run.
another dot to the scorebook. Ali finding a probing length
pushed out to point, a hint of width

reverse sweep, and Australia have lost their third wicket in ten balls! Stoinis drops to one knee, attempts to pick the gap, but merely picks out gully instead! A disappointing debut ends. With the bat at least ...
cautiously onto the back foot, defended with a considered view of bat on ball
weight forward this time but same result. And that's Moeen done for the day. 10 overs, 2 for 40. Excellent work
wide outside off, Wade tries to reach but can't connect
clunked into the covers and a slight misfield allows the single
too wide this time and called as such
forward and defended
waits in the crease, nudges a single out to point
pushed onto the  back foot, defended into the crease. Good heat on that delivery, as they like to say
another splice-rattler. Excellent straight line of attack from Plunkett and England are turning the screw for the moment.
driven outside off stump, but an inside-edge bobbles back into the crease
full and straight, driven down the ground for one more run
short and lifting into the gloves, turned off the toes
better from Hastings, a bit of width and leathered through the covers with a good stride and a firm slap. Shot
tucked into the leg-side. Tighter line
attempted yorker. In fact, you might even call it a well-executed yorker. Either way, it was very full, suitably dug out, and no run
short and slapped out to midwicket
blam! That's how Hastings operates, a fraction too short, and slammed over midwicket
driven into the covers
full length, swatted out to deep midwicket
full toss, waist high, carelessly loose, and that has given Hastings full licence to play baseball. Home run through wide long-on
another attempted yorker, goes awry but not expensively so this time.
outside off, seaming past the edge, a Test-match delivery, met with a one-day waft. Which is an elaborate way of saying no run, through to the keeper
bosh. Levers. Front leg retreats to square leg, bat swings through. Get some of that

blam! Hastings takes on his Durham team-mate again, and nearly skulls him in his follow-through. Half a thought of attempting a return catch. But then the other half of Wood's brain recognised discretion was better part of valour
loose from Wood, a glove-high full toss, and Wade is aghast it is not called a no-ball. That was an off-line beamer, to all intents and purposes
driven out to the covers. More conventional length, and stroke
firmly struck out to deep midwicket
Willey, round the wicket, walloped out to midwicket. Low full toss
lovely bowling, back over the wicket, a yorker tailing in late. Nothing Wade can do but chop it onto his boot and sprint
smack-tastic! Another brutal swing of the bat, clean through the line as Willey misses his mark and Hastings indulges in a spot of range-hitting
full toss, on the pads, Hales at deep square leg shows good hands to save the boundary and whistle in a quick return
clipped off the toes, out to backward square leg
Wade keeps the strike, which England might not mind too much in the circumstances
low full toss, clipped out to midwicket
remarkable stroke from Wade. Stepped out to the off side, Wood followed him, Wade got in a tangle with his ramp shot, but four is the upshot as he flicks the ball off his visor over the keeper's head
a loud cheer from the crowd but it's off the pad into the keeper's gloves
blatted over midwicket as Wade picked Wood's slower ball. So much for Hastings being off-strike, this will do nicely for Australia
punched into the covers
pushed onto the back foot, defended back down the track. Vital late impetus here for Australia
turns inside out and flicks a sweep past his leg stump. Sweetly played
thumped hard, but the field is well set as long-off tidies up
smashed out to deep midwicket, a bit of a predictable length from Willey there, but the sweeper is in position
up and under, a one-bounce four inches inside the rope at midwicket. Wade got right underneath that, almost a slog sweep
low full toss, but effective in the circumstances. Drilled out to deep midwicket
Hastings' turn to keep the strike as Australia enter the final over with dreams of 300 back in their mind's eye
clumped out to mid-on
Wade unfurls the scoop shot again and that is stunningly timed, high over the keeper's head, straight out of the meat of the middle. Remarkable
crashed into the gap at long-on, they scamper back for two
massive! A pre-meditated move to the off-side and a violent wallop across the line as Wood pays the price for dropping too short. Gosh
thumped down the ground for a single. Wade's final ball of the innings completes his fifty from 26 balls
swung hard and loose out to extra cover. That is a fantastic finale - 65 runs from the last five overs and England have a battle (of Hastings, clearly) on their hands to stay in the series.
outside off stump, left well alone
driven compactly into the covers. Fielded with a similar degree of focus
on the pads, flicked fine but can't beat the field
down the leg side, that one is called
down the track and driven back to the bowler
shorter, and Roy is cut in half as one nips back off the seam
a tidy finish to a tidy over. A punch of the gloves as Hales prepares to take strike at the other end
full length, gently dug out of the blockhole

full, fast, and that is out! Hales was done for pace, and despite a brief consultation he opts not to review. Stunning start from the lightning-quick Cummins. Hales hasn't had a lot of joy in this series so far
full and straight again. Cummins is majoring on speed x accuracy
slightly shorter and spliced into the covers
another massive appeal! Dharmasena says this one is sliding down, and Australia reluctantly agree. Sheer pace from Cummins and England at the moment have no answers
now that's an answer! On the pads and sweetly timed, a clipped drive from Taylor whistles to the rope. Shot
flicked away fine, slight misdirection from Pattinson
swift from both ends as Taylor defends
whistles past the edge into the keeper's gloves. Sharp
on the pads, very full, and England accept the extra as square leg tidies up
tighter line, no way through as Roy beds in
a swish outside off, the ball dies a touch through to the keeper. Slim pickings for England so far
compact and superb. Taylor's second four and both have been immaculate. Driven hard and flat through the gap in the covers
width, and Taylor chases it hard, a flash outside off but his timing is impeccable as he meets it on the top of the bounce and crunches it past point
over-compensation as Cummins spears this down the leg side
full length, driven on the up to midwicket. Taylor keen to put bat on ball and doing it effectively so far
fantastic strike as Roy joins the counterattack. A hint of width and walloped through the covers
times the pants off a flick through midwicket, but unluckily picks out the man at short midwicket. Never mind, next time ...
full and hinting to swing back in. Driven calmly to mid-off. An eventful over
a leg-stump half-volley and Taylor isn't going to squander those. For all the speed (and no, afraid I can't see the speedgun on this telly, sorry) there have been some loose deliveries at both ends
oversteps now. Free hit coming up
good riposte, right in the blockhole. Toe-ended down the track. Well bowled in the circumstances
Alan, whose telly has better settings, says that was 88mph
outside off, at 89mph, through to the keeper
crunched! Short and wide, a rank delivery at any pace, and Taylor uses every inch of his height to climb into the shot and punch a hole in the covers
same ball, same shot, same result, with the added crowd bonus of a misfield at point. A pretty grim over, but England capitalised well on the offerings
down to 81mph, a veritable sighter
slashed down to third man as Roy climbs into the width on offer
fuller and straighter
tighter line and length
utterly belted through the covers - full length but too much width and Roy was all over that like the proverbial
spawny, but effective! Full again, a loose drive, a thick inside-edge, and leg stump is jolly lucky to still be standing ...
slightly early on the drive as this one bobbles off the splice into the leg side, but there's no-one on hand to catch it. Taylor's eagerness to attack nearly his undoing
width, and fenced down to third man
flicked down to fine leg
driven on the up
outside off, a drop of the wrists and a steer down to third man for the single
outside off, and pushed out to point.
sumptuous straight drive as Hastings over-pitches. The fifty is up and England are motoring
squared up by a fuller length, but no great alarm
outside off, driven into the covers but can't pierce the field this time
another single to the total
an ambitious slash but can't beat point
driven to mid-off with one hand leaving the bat for good effect
outside off and nearly a chop-on as Roy fences with feet stuck in concrete. But he survives
get some of that! The latter-day flamingo shot from one of KP's Surrey acolytes. And it's a one-bounce four over long-on. Bosh
steered down to third man
flicked through the gap at midwicket
smashing strokeplay! A big stride, a powerful drive, an unstoppable four through the covers. He is seeing it like ... <del>the proverbial</del> a planet
one more to the total as England continue to bite chunks out of their requirement. It's an easy game when you're on top
up and over! Roy meets a full length with a full face, straight back over the bowler's head. Top tonking
wider on the crease, attacking the stumps, defended. Respect
slower and wider, swished down to third man like a fly-fisherman on the Trent
fuller and straighter. Defended
a massive appeal for caught behind but the umpire is unmoved. And so too, after a long consultation, are the Aussies. Might have been thigh pad. Indeed it was

like Asterix on his magic potion, the little man packs a punch! This one nearly chins Hastings in his followthrough like an uppercut, not dissimilar to the one administered to Gluteus Maximus in Olympic Games
a change of ends, a change of luck! Cummins lures Roy into a loose poke into the covers. A tame end to a cracking innings. Scrambled seam and Roy was through the stroke too soon.
banged in short, and called as one for the over, but not an outright wide
on the hip, fenced past short leg, Morgan is off the mark
outside off and fenced out to point
fully into line and defended back down the track
tucked off the toes, and another one to the total
slapped hard into the covers, and a fumble gifts England another single
sweetly timed, 87mph delivery, and escorted out towards the rope by a convoy of Australian fielders. A presidential stroke.
full and straight, compact defence
chopped through backward point, Australia's line and length hasn't been all that. Except when it has, obviously, as Hales can attest
outside off, Taylors angles for the call of wide, but he is denied
short of a length, Morgan hops into line
cautiously watching ball onto bat
on the pads, flicks the flap and tidied up at point
outside off, no stroke offered
banged in short, whisked out to midwicket where it is tidied up on the rope
outside off, poked out to point. Australia tighten the screw after a woolly few overs
tidy line and length
a punched drive to short cover
flashed out to deep cover
good restrictive areas from Marsh
... but that's a fine response from Taylor, who latches onto a fractionally overpitched delivery and punches a drive straight past the bowler
tucked off the toes, a better end to the over from England and Taylor
pounded in short, one for the over. But again, not called wide
too much width, slashed in the air through the vacant cordon down to third man. All very deliberate
a hint of an appeal but that missed everything as it zipped through to the keeper
ambitious flat-footed slash, albeit it with both feet off the ground, half an enquiry for caught behind
hops into line outside off. Another over ticks by
a sweetly timed drive, only just intercepted at full stretch by a diving mid-off
punched back down the track

wow, what a take! Massive dive to his left, down the leg-side, as Taylor flicked so fine that it was almost the perfect one-day stroke. But Wade was equal to the task, and that is a massive breakthrough
off the mark straight away, with a clip through midwicket
end of an eventful over. This match, indeed this series, is still utterly in the balance
outside off, no stroke offered
rising on middle stump, met with a resolute straight bat
chopped down to third man, a touch of width to work with
short and pulled hard round the corner, not completely timed but definitely middled, as there were two men back for the top edge
banged in short, no stroke offered
bit of a rubbish ball really. Down the leg side and through to the keeper on the third bounce
drilled into the covers, another run to the total as England set about a rebuilding phase
lovely strike but straight to cover
clipped off the toes at a sedate 82mph. Out to deep midwicket
slashed hard outside off stump and so nearly a chop-on. Wade does well to cut off the runs with a swallow dive behind the stumps
tighter line, tighter shot
too much width and Morgan improvises to make the most of it. He ended up deliberately toe-ending it out of the reach of the men lurking in the gully. They all count
stands and delivers. But can't time the stroke
time for some spin, as Maxwell twirls one onto a good length from round the wicket
outside leg stump, Morgan tries to flick it fine but settles for the wide
better line and length, defended back down the wicket
forward and defended again
pushed out to deep point
forward and defended into the covers again, a tidy exploratory over
compact punch into the covers
slashed hard, on the up, out to the cover boundary. Intent from Stokes, even though the execution isn't all that just yet
a scything cut, under-edged into the crease
crunched out to mid-off, nearly carried all the way to the fielder, who intercepted with a tumble
a firm swish but the field is well set, lots of cover on the off side to limit the impact
full length, poked out to point.
round the wicket, tossed up outside off, tapped towards point
flatter, Morgan reverses the hands and swats the ball to the same fielder
pushed through, Morgan tries to cut and misses
angled in with the arm, tries to push forward and gets an inside edge to leg
fired in very full and Stokes nearly gets yorked, drops the bat in time and squeezes the ball out past the stumps
pushed through on the stumps and tapped into the covers - tight stuff from Maxwell
pushed across too wide for Morgan to reach at full stretch
Marsh fires it towards the tramlines again, Morgan swings and misses
length ball around leg stump, clipped through midwicket for a single
goes round the wicket, length delivery outside off that Stokes blocks into the covers
pitched up, skips forward and mistimes a drive towards extra cover
slightly slower delivery, pinged neatly back down the ground but long-on collects to allow just a single
back over the wicket to Morgan, pitched up in the slot and steered through the covers to the sweeper
Stokes attempts to take the attack to Maxwell and scoops the ball over the leg side, doesn't really get hold of it but lands safely in a gap
tossed up and tapped back to the bowler
now Morgan goes after him and sends this into orbit...! That will come down with snow on it somewhere deep in the western terrace
angled down the leg side behind Morgan's leg
tossed up and pushed gently into the covers
floated on off stump, pushed into the covers
lovely stroke, gets the front foot to the pitch and squires a drive through the covers, gives the man in the deep the burn and that's four more
back of a length outside off, tailing away as Stokes swings and misses
nice high arm, on the stumps and worked into a gap at midwicket
pushed across the left-hander from over the wicket, Morgan has to stretch to deflect one to third man
pace up towards 87mph, tight wicket-to-wicket stuff, dabbed into the leg side
slightly back of a length, chopped into the ground and Stoinis fields in his follow through

shortish outside off, Stokes flashes at it and misses... or does he? Well, Stoinis thinks he nicked it, Dharmasena seems to be asking his partner whether it carried... Looks like Australia have asked for a review anyway. Well, there's a faint sound as the ball passes the bat, a thin scrape off the toe - but replays suggest it bounced into the gloves. Wade only half-appealed, so perhaps he wasn't sure but Joel Wilson decides there's clear evidence and the review is struck down
short ball, at the body and Morgan hoicks it in ungainly fashion out towards deep square leg
extra bounce for Patto and Stokes is squared up, thick-edges down to third man... Well wide of slip, had there been one in
good length around off, Stokes steers it square
slides down the leg side as Stokes tries to glance unsuccessfully
short at the body, maybe rolled his fingers over it... Stokes certainly rolled his wrists and sends the ball fine for a more genuine boundary
comes forward to tap a length ball into the covers
lummy, that's a cracking shot, steps out to on drive on the up, clean through the line and it zips between mid-on and mid-off and away to the fence. Sublime
pushed across Morgan, who gets a thick outside edge to third man
defended coming forward on off stump
pitched up and Stokes advances with intent to strike a drive through the covers
slower ball, cutter sits up outside off, Morgan flat-bats it through cover-point to the sweeper
good length on off, pretty disciplined line bowling from Stoinis, defended
touch short, pretty good pace, high 80s mph and cut firmly but straight to backward point
tossed up on off and pushed back down the ground to long-on
angled in towards the stumps, Stokes bows his head over a forward defensive
gives it some air, Stokes opens up his shoulders and steers a drive through the covers
slower, skidding on as Morgan stays back and defends
drops back and swats a cut through point into the deep for one
tossed up on the stumps, comes forward and clips one down the ground
short ball, taking the pace off, Stokes pulls through backward sqaure
half-tracker from Stoinis, possibly out the back of the hand and Morgan bludgeons it down the ground, through the shot a little early but it span away from mid-on and off to the rope
another bumper, this time flipped down to fine leg
pitched up, Stokes comes forward to drive and an inside edge pops into the covers
on the pads and glanced through backward square
back of a length, tailing away outside off stump as Morgan pulls, plays over the top of it
angled in and punched down the ground to long-on
tossed up, Morgan walks out and pushes along the ground to long-off
angled in and tapped into the covers
tossed up on the stumps, Stokes leaves the crease and clips one more to long-on
flighted a touch, drifting in on the stumps as Morgan presses forward to shake hands
another push down the ground to long-on, rotating the strike
Stoinis rumbles in, shades of Watto but he hits 87mph, Morgan chops it into the ground
skips forward, shortish ball at the body, can't get it away to leg
back of a length, stays back this time and swats a single down to fine leg
bends the back and fires the ball in full at 87mph, Stokes digs it out towards mid-on
short again and this time it's muscled through midwicket, in the air but it bounces in front of the man on the boundary and skips away
good length around off stump, prodded into the covers
angled in with the arm, Morgan pushes it down to long-on
tossed up, Stokes leans into a forward defensive
flighted, on middle and off, Stokes watches it right on to the bat again
makes a little room and nudges the ball away through midwicket for one more
pushed through outside off, bit of width but Morgan finds backward point
tossed up, comes forward and pushes one more through the covers in controlled fashion
short outside off and Morgan cuts, a misfield at backward point helps him to a couple and takes him to another half-century - been in rich form for England this summer
gets forward and taps a half-volley to long-off
round the wicket, Stokes gets across to defend
good length on off stump, Stokes shows it a straight bat again
Marsh sends down an offcutter, Stokes tries to work to leg and gets a leading edge
strays a little too close to the pads and this is helped firmly on its way through backward square for another useful boundary
angled in with the arm, Morgan happy to play pat-a-cake for another single down the ground
tossed up, Stokes gets forward and pushes to long-on this time
full outside off, driven past the diving Maxwell to long-off
steps out of his crease early, Maxwell drops a little short and it comes off bat and pad into a gap at cover, they amble one
darted in on the stumps, flicked behind square but straight to short fine leg
tossed up, slightly wide and Morgan thwacks a drive, can't beat the cover fielder, however
touch short, over the stumps, worked into the leg side
pitched up outside off, makes a bit of room to drive but picks out a fielder

bowled him, slips a yorker under the bat, Stokes is gone! May have taken the pace off a touch and Stokes was beaten aiming a push down the ground, he looks back in disgust... A decent, controlled knock, and a useful stand but that's opened up a chink for Australia to try and exploit
over the wicket, slightly back of a length, defended in front of off stump
touch short but not wide enough to cut, Bairstow gets an inside edge on to his pads and it rolls away square for a single
sprayed wide and Morgan broomhandles it through backward point, in the air but between two men and the crowd indulges in some raucous cheering as it bounces to the fence
short of a length and pulled in business-like fashion out towards deep square leg for a couple
back of a length outside off and this is steered through the covers for one more
on the pads and flicked through backward square leg
YJB comes out and pushes another run through the covers

hello! Morgan's landed the ball on the roof the football stand! He picked his, ahem, battle and absolutely launched a length ball down the ground, it's ended up in some guttering, I think... The umpires have to send for a replacement
short outside off and slapped to backward point
on the stumps and Bairstow tries to nudge off his pads, his hit on the thigh
back of a length and defended into the leg side
angling in on the stumps, waits for it and times a flick off his front pad through square leg
pitched up and clubbed down the ground, a clean swing of his four iron and the ball goes skipping away to long-off
pitched full again, this time a rapier punch flies past the dive of cover for a couple
shuffles across and defends the last ball of the over
shortish outside off and Bairstow slaps one rustically through backward point
not a bad ball this but it's deftly played by Morgan, opens the face and late-dabs it fine to third man
oof, nearly undoes that with an attempted repeat, beats the outside edge this time and sails  through to Wade
makes room and slashes at a similar, back-of-a-length ball, a thick edge soars beyond the diving Wade and away for four more
on the stumps and paddled away through the leg side
back of a length, Bairstow shuffles back on to off stump and blocks it
pitched up wide of the stumps and Morgan flays another boundary through the covers. He's looking in tip-top nick
too straight, Morgan flicks into a gap on the leg side and they race through for three more
short outside off, opens the face and runs one to third man
full and straight, nicely timed drive back along the ground but Patto stretches out a hand to stop it
back of a length, tucked off the hips through midwicket
oh, scintillating stuff, overptiched by Pattinson and Bairstow leans into a gorgeous-looking rasp through the covers for another four
length ball but it drifts behind Morgan down the leg side
full outside off, pitching wedge from Morgan, lands in a gap out towards deep extra cover
slower ball, steps out and strokes one more to long-off
crunched! Another slower ball from Bairstow and he shovels it through the covers, a heavy bottom-handed slippering
good length outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
pitched up and driven off his toes to long-on
length delivery on off stump, Bairstow taps it back down the track in defence
pitched up, on the stumps, jabbed back towards the bowler

back of a length outside off, Morgan guides it towards Maxwell at backward point, he's anticipating a sharp throw but instead fails to pick it up cleanly and they pinch a single anyway - Morgan throwing himself full length as Maxwell hurls it towards the non-striker's end
drops back and inside-edges down between his legs, Morgan calls him through for another quick single

pitched up and sliced to backward point WHERE MAXWELL GRABS A SCREAMER! Australia are still in this, Morgan falls short of a hundred thanks to a brilliant one-handed take from Maxwell low to his right, more than making up for his fumble a couple of balls ago. Cummins has his third and England still have a bit of work to do
length ball around off, Moeen defends into the off side
tight line, again Moeen gets across and shows it a straight bat
turned square, to no effect
tucked off the toes, out to square leg
back of a length, steered into the covers with a languid push
clipped firmly off the toes. Confident bat on ball from Moeen so far
down the track, and shovelled from Bairstow into the leg side. No convincing but finds the gap
held back again, Moeen stands tall but can't pierce the gap. Only three from the over
full and straight, punched to mid-off
crunched, backward of point, as Cummins' extra pace proves his undoing. The faster they come, the faster they disappear if the line isn't right
stands tall, but can't time a slash off the back foot into the covers
that is a waist-high no-ball, 88mph, straight at Bairstow's box, and he has scooped it high and handsome, clean over backward square!
impressive attempt to cash in again, throwing himself, goalkeeper-style, at a wide full-toss. Chopped down to third man
banged in short, pulled hard, out to midwicket. This could be a game-sealing over [he says, ducking]
fuller, straighter, swish and a miss. England need fewer than a run a ball
smashed, into the hands of deep midwicket, who is blasted, cannonball-style, over the ropes for a maximum! A brutally struck sweep, and Moeen's valour is paid off
crunched out to Burns again on the rope, who gets an ironic cheer for his troubles
drawn down the track, defended
reverse-sweep, through to the keeper with a loud cry of triumph, and they have gone for the review. It's a fair delivery, and is there a hint of a hot spot on the glove? He's a goner
no messing around. Walloped through midwicket with an Emburey-esque disdain for footwork. Shot
worked into the leg-side, off the pad, a good over for England regardless of the wicket
through to the keeper, too much heat to handle there
more of the same. Plunkett having a flirt outside off, but can't make contact
straighter, and smashed into the leg side. Just the one to the total
crunched into the covers
whisked down to third man, sharp running brings two

edged, and dropped! Wade followed the chance with one hand, and it was into the mitt and out again. It hit him on the wrist, a definite chance. Made a lot of ground, and having done so, he should have completed that
fetch that and bowl me another! Stands and delivers, a violent wallop over the covers
chopped down to third man, Plunkett justifying his promotion as a man who likes to use his levers to good effect
full and straight, big appeal and a review but that pitched outside leg. It would have splattered all three stumps, but them's the rules

bang! And the ball is gone! Vast straight strike, down the ground, out of sight. Massive shot, and the punters in the hospitality boxes don't want to return the ball. A steward eventually snatches it and flings it back in a huff
shorter, pulled out to midwicket
width, Ali chases it and inside-edges to midwicket. Another excellent over for England

wow, was that actually a clean catch? It's becoming commonplace these days, to take the ball above the head, on the rope, stagger back, lob the ball back into play, leap back over the rope, snaffle the rebound in mid-air and land as if nothing has happened. But Glenn Maxwell has just done it again! And Plunkett's clunk-it innings is over
pushed back into the crease, Ali defends. England need to be a little careful now ...
a compact drive, out to cover. Ali content to see off the pace of Cummins now, it would seem
valuable runs as Cummins' errs in line. 15 now to win
resolutely defended, right behind the line of the ball
pushed into the covers and Cummins is done for the day. And so too, nearly, are Australia. Three wickets to win, but England bat deep. No rush, surely
tossed up, and a bit of a nervy poke almost ends up back in the bowler's hands! Maybe he should just tonk it
flicked off the pads and Willey gratefully accepts the single
defended again
swept hard, swept fine, swept into the gap! A fraction too short from Maxwell and he paid the price!
tossed up, punched into the gap at cover, the requirement is down to 8
on the pads, that's a free run as Willey nurdles it fine. Maxwell's excellent day's work is done, barring another intercession in the field of course
round the wicket, a crashing uppercut drive out to cover, and England steal an overthrow as the shy comes in from the deep! Wade allowed the ball to hit the stumps and ricochet away
another single, another loud cheer from a partisan crowd
no way through this time
a compact drive to straight mid-off. Another dot
on the pads, tucked to square leg. Another single to the total
blockhole ball, effectively dug out. England need three runs, Australia need three wickets ...
whisked out to midwicket, another single. Australia's goose is cooked
woomph! A massive slap for six straight down the ground! David Willey finishes the match as he started it, with a flourish!
